data.text:

She worked as a Management Systems Auditor/Lead Auditor and Trainer at the Quality Systems Training Department (2010- 2013). Between 2013 and 2015, she was the Sectoral Management Systems Manager and took part in the committees of the International Certification Network (IQNET), representing TSE. Between 2015 and 2022, she served as a Lead Researcher at the Inspection and Surveillance Center of TSE.

During her time at TSE, she worked as a Lead Auditor, Auditor, Technical Expert and Trainer in many conformity assessment areas. Within the scope of accreditation standards ( EN ISO / IEC 17025, EN ISO 14065), she took part in the working groups in the accreditation processes of TSE. Lead Verifier, Technical Expert and Trainer under the National MRV Regulation of Greenhouse Gas Emissions. Lead Verifier and Trainer within the scope of EN ISO 14064-1 standard. Lead Auditor/Auditor/Trainer in management systems. (EN ISO 9001, EN ISO 14001, EN ISO 22000, EN ISO 45001, EN ISO 50001, ISO 10002, ISO 22301, ISO 28000, EN 15224, ISO 31000)

OIC/SMIIC 35 Conformity Assessment – General Requirements for the Competence of Laboratories Performing Halal Testing- Assessor.

He carried out studies on behaviour-oriented safety, HSE culture change, and compliance of refinery processes with new environmental legislation until 2011.

In the role of Chief Process Engineer between 2011-2022 he carried out studies on feasibility, economic evaluation, process selection, on-site commissioning, operation, bottleneck removal, process improvement, chemical monitoring, HAZOP, LCA, BAT-BREF compliance, water and wastewater management of refinery environmental units, preparation of water & energy saving roadmaps, compliance with ISO 14001, ISO 14064, ISO 45001 standards and legal regulations. During his duty, he carried out the process selection, commissioning and process improvement follow-up of the largest wastewater recovery plant (45,000 m3/day capacity) of Turkiye, which received numerous awards in many national and international platforms. He has diversified his work with R&D (Integroil, Aquaspice, EpcEqTech, Coralis, Hydroptics) and innovation projects funded under the EU-supported HORIZON 2020 in the fields of water management, circular economy, waste reduction and sustainability. Ömer ÇAĞLAR, who is also a Class A OHS Expert, has published articles on various specializations of environmental engineering such as waste water recovery, Life Cycle Assessment (LCA), performance monitoring with machine learning techniques in reverse osmosis systems, and odour removal with clinoptilolite.
